com.topcoder.util.idgenerator
Class IDGeneratorImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.util.idgenerator.IDGeneratorImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDGenerator
public class IDGeneratorImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDGenerator

This class is the core of the component and actually generates the IDs. It is also used by IDGeneratorBean. This class queries a database to find the current state of the sequence -- the lowest ID not yet generated, and the current block size. It allocates to itself the next "block" of IDs and then updates the ID sequence state in the database accordingly, then allocates IDs from this block until exhausted. Note that larger block sizes are more efficient, as this class has to make fewer database updates. However also note that any IDs not yet assigned when this instance is destroyed are simply lost, so large block sizes may also result in larger "gaps" in the ID sequence. This class requires a javax.sql.DataSource instance to be made available under the JNDI name "java:comp/env/jdbc/com/topcoder/util/idgenerator/IDGeneratorDataSource"; this DataSource is used to access the ID table. This class is synchronized for thread-safety.

Notes: the default connection name is 'DefaultSequence' for DBConnectionFactory component.

Version:
3.0
Author:
srowen, iggy36, gua

Constructor Detail

IDGeneratorImpl

public IDGeneratorImpl(java.lang.String idName)
                throws IDGenerationException
Creates a new IDGeneratorImpl for the named ID sequence.

Parameters:
idName - name of the ID sequence encapsulated by this instance.
Throws:
NoSuchIDSequenceException - if name is null, or no such ID sequence is configured in the database
IDGenerationException - if an error occurs while retrieving ID sequence configuration (for example, database errors)

getNextID

public long getNextID()
               throws IDGenerationException
Returns the next ID in the ID sequence encapsulated by this instance. Internal state is updated so that this ID is not returned again from this method.

Specified by:
getNextID in interface IDGenerator
Returns:
the next ID in the ID sequence
Throws:
IDsExhaustedException - if all possible values in the ID sequence have been assigned and no more can be assigned
IDGenerationException - if an error occurs while generating the ID (for example, error while connecting to the database)
NoSuchIDSequenceException - if there is no appropriate sequence defined in the backing DB

getNextBigID

public java.math.BigInteger getNextBigID()
                                  throws IDGenerationException

Wraps the value that would be returned by getNextID() in a BigInteger instance and returns it.

Throws:
